webforest 0.2.1

Set row-level styling on a WebSpec

Source: R/modifiers.R
set_row_style.Rd

Provides a fluent API for setting row-level styling based on column values. Style values are read from the specified columns at render time.

set_row_style(
  x,
  bold = NULL,
  italic = NULL,
  color = NULL,
  bg = NULL,
  badge = NULL,
  icon = NULL,
  indent = NULL,
  type = NULL,
  weight = NULL,
  emphasis = NULL,
  muted = NULL,
  accent = NULL
)

Arguments

x

A WebSpec object or an htmlwidget created by forest_plot/webtable

bold

Column name containing logical values for row-level bold

italic

Column name containing logical values for row-level italic

color

Column name containing CSS color strings for row text color

bg

Column name containing CSS color strings for row background color

badge

Column name containing text for badges on the label column

icon

Column name containing emoji/unicode for icons on the label column

indent

Column name containing numeric values for row indentation

type

Column name containing row type ("data", "header", "summary", "spacer")

weight

Column name for marker weight/size scaling (numeric values, typically 0-100)

emphasis

Column name containing logical values for emphasis styling (uses theme primary color)

muted

Column name containing logical values for muted styling (uses theme muted color)

accent

Column name containing logical values for accent styling (uses theme accent color)

Value

The modified WebSpec object (or widget)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
forest_data |>
  web_spec(hr, lower, upper) |>
  set_row_style(bold = "is_primary", badge = "significance") |>
  forest_plot()
} # }
